title: ISic000184. Funerary inscription for the slave Ianuarius
body:
Facsimile Images

1IANUARIUS
2SERVIXANXIIX
3SUCCESSAFILIOPIO

Apparatus criticus

Text after autopsy

English translation

Ianuarius, slave, lived for 18 years. Successa (set this up) for her dutiful son

commentary

Ianuarius is a common name attested elsewhere in Sicily, see e.g. ISic000431, as well as elsewhere in the empire. Successa is equally as common in the empire, and there is one attestation of a masculine version of the name in Sicily, ISic003244. Bivona (1994) suggests that the mother, Successa, was most likely a slave, as was her son, Ianuarius.

bibliography

  • Fiorelli 1878 111 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • 10.7413 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 106 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
